block.p: A guide to cultural and recreational goings-on in and around Westchester and Putnam Counties this week. Items for the guide should be sent at least three weeks in advance to westweek@nytimes.com, or by mail to Westchester Cultural Calendar, 229 West 43rd Street, New York, N.Y. 10036-3959.
FILM
Katonah Annual Katonah Film Project series: ''All the President's Men,'' directed by Alan J. Pakula. April 14 at 7:30 p.m. $5. Katonah Village Library, 26 Bedford Road. (914) 232-3508.
Mamaroneck ''Free Zone,'' directed by Amos Gitai. Through April 8. $5 to $8. Emelin Theater, 153 Library Lane. (914) 698-0098.

Pleasantville ''Radio Rock,'' directed by Jun-ik Lee; in Korean with English subtitles. With a question-and-answer session with the actors Joong-hoon Park and Sung-kee Ahn and Jonathan Demme. Wednesday at 7 p.m. $12 and $16. Jacob Burns Film Center, 364 Manville Road. (914) 773-7663.

Purchase French Film Festival: ''The Beat That My Heart Skipped,'' directed by Jacques Audiard; in French with English subtitles. April 15 at 7 p.m. Free. Music Building, Manhattanville College, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5260.

Purchase ''The New Cycle of Peasant Struggles in Mexico and Bolivia,'' documentary; screening and discussion. Wednesday at 3 p.m. Free. PepsiCo Theater at Purchase College, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6166.
Tarrytown ''Speedy,'' comedy directed by Donald Sosin. April 15 at noon. $6 and $9. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
Yonkers ''Hip Hop: Beyond Beats and Rhymes,'' documentary; screening followed by a panel discussion. Monday at 6:30 p.m. Free. Reisinger Concert Hall, Sarah Lawrence College. (914) 395-2412.
Yonkers ''Madeinusa,'' directed by Claudia Llosa. Wednesday at 2 p.m. Free. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
FOR CHILDREN
Nyack Milk and Cookies Playhouse: Jeffery Friedberg and the Bossy Frog Band, family music. April 14 at 10 a.m. $7 and $9. Riverspace, 119 Main Street. (845) 348-0741.

Suffern ''Mammoth Follies,'' an original dinosaur musical; presented by the Hudson Vagabond Puppets. April 15 at 2:30 p.m. $10 and $12. Cultural Arts Theater, Rockland Community College, 145 College Road. (845) 732-8186.
Yonkers ''Introduction to Mammals,'' a look at furry animals. Ages 7 to 10. April 14, 10 to 11 a.m. Free; registration required. Lenoir Preserve, Dudley Street.
Yonkers ''Music and Merriment,'' children's program. Ages 2 to 5. Through June 20. Yonkers Crestwood Library, 16 Thompson Street. (914) 337-1500 Extension 360.

Yonkers ''Mother Goose Time,'' nursery rhymes, stories, songs and finger plays. Ages 2 to 4. Through May 17. Free; registration required. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
MUSIC AND DANCE

Bronxville Marcella Calabi and Afra Morganti, sopranos, and Paolo Ceccarini, pianist; songs and duets by Italian and American composers. April 15 at 2 p.m. Free. Bronxville Public Library, 201 Pondfield Road. (914) 337-7680.

Bronxville Rachel Luxon, soprano; Abraham Appleman, violinist; Ronald Arron, violist; Edward Arron, cellist, and Jeewon Park, pianist; performing works by Pleyel, Brahms, Beethoven and others. April 15 at 2:30 p.m. $15 and $25. Christ Church, 17 Sagamore Road. (914) 337-3544.

Dobbs Ferry ''Annual a Cappella Extravaganza,'' performance and competition by a cappella groups from various schools. April 15 at 2 p.m. $5 and $10. The Masters School, 49 Clinton Avenue. (914) 332-5953.

Irvington Guy Clark and guest, Slaid Cleaves, contemporary folk. Friday at 8:30 p.m. $35. ''Maiden Voyage,'' performed by the Westchester Jazz Orchestra. April 14 at 8 p.m. $25 and $30. Irvington Town Hall, 85 Main Street. (914) 591-6602.
Katonah ''Ringing in the Spring,'' performance by Katonah Celebration Ringers, hand bell group. April 15 at 2 p.m. $12. John Jay Homestead Historic Site, Route 22. (914) 232-5651.
Middletown The Kennedys, folk duet. April 15 at 3 p.m. $22 and $25. Morrison Mansion, Orange County Community College. (845) 343-3049.
New Rochelle Jim Malloy and Friends, a concert of mellow jazz and blues. April 14 at 2:30 p.m. $2. New Rochelle Public Library, 1 Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
Ossining Dikki Du and the Zydeco Krew. April 15, 5 to 9:30 p.m. $18. Zydeco Hall, 7 Old Albany Post Road. (914) 528-7612.

Peekskill Leo Kottke and David Lindley, guitarists. April 14 at 8 p.m. $30 to $40. Turtle Island Quartet. April 15 at 3 p.m. $35. Paramount Center for the Arts, 1008 Brown Street. (914) 930-7588. POUGHKEEPSIE Buddy Guy, blues. April 15 at 7 p.m. $38.50 to $44.50. Bardavon 1869 Opera House, 35 Market Street. (845) 473-2072.

Purchase ''Latin Explosion!'' presented by the Purchase Latin Jazz Orchestra; featuring works by Dizzy Gillespie, Phil Woods and a selection of new works. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. $20. PepsiCo Theater at Purchase College, 735 Anderson Hill Road. (914) 251-6166.
Rhinebeck The Cassatt String Quartet; works by Mendelssohn, Beethoven and Dvorak. April 14 at 7:30 p.m. $5 to $25. Church of the Messiah, 6436 Montgomery Street. (845) 876-2870.
Rye Pacifica String Quartet; works by Mendelssohn, Janacek and Smetana. April 15 at 8 p.m. $35. Congregation Emanu-El, 2125 Westchester Avenue East. (914) 967-4382.
Tarrytown The Sleepy Hollow Annual Jazz Fest, high school jazz ensembles and artists. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $8 to $11. Tarrytown Music Hall, 13 Main Street. (914) 631-3390.
Valhalla The Battery Dance Company, performance and instructional session. Wednesday, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Free. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.

White Plains ''Melodies From Brazil and Cuba,'' with Vento Trio; Janet Grice, bassoonist; Kevin Willois, flutist, and Sarah Koval, clarinetist. Wednesday at 12:10 p.m. Free. Grace Church, 33 Church Street. (914) 949-2478.

White Plains ''Big Things Happen at the Little Theater'' series: Leon Russell, singer-songwriter. April 14 at 8 p.m. $35. Westchester County Center, junction of Central Avenue, Tarrytown Road and the Bronx River Parkway. (914) 995-4050.

Yonkers Trio di Camerati, presented by the Chaminade Music Club; featuring works by Cy Brandon, Frederick Werle and Noel Regney. Tuesday at 2 p.m. $5. Yonkers Public Library, Grinton I. Will branch, 1500 Central Park Avenue. (914) 337-1500.
SPOKEN WORD
Annandale-on-Hudson Mei-Mei Berssenbrugge and Sawako Nakayasu, poetry performance and reading. Thursday at 5 p.m. Free. Weis Cinema, (845) 758-1539.

Garrison Pots, Painters and Petticoats,'' seminar series: ''Hudson Valley Stoneware and Redware,'' lecture by George Lukacs, historian and author. April 14 at 10 a.m. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

New Rochelle ''Meet the Authors,'' children's book authors including Jean Van Leeuwen, Marisabina Russo, Roni Schotter and Campbell Geeslin. April 14 at 1 p.m. New Rochelle Public Library, 1 Library Plaza. (914) 632-7878.
Sleepy Hollow Stephen Stepanchev, Jackie Sheeler and Brenda Connor-Bey, poets. Friday at 7:30 p.m. $3 and $5. Hudson Valley Writers' Center, 300 Riverside Drive. (914) 332-5953.

Tarrytown Andrew Burnstein, author of ''The Original Knickerbocker,'' lecture and reading. April 15 at 1:30 p.m. Free. Washington Irving's Sunnyside, 89 West Sunnyside Lane, off Route 9. (914) 631-8200.
Valhalla Anna Mione, author of ''Sicilian Love Story,'' reading and discussion. Wednesday at 11:15 a.m. Free. Fine Arts Gallery, 75 Grasslands Road. (914) 606-7867.
THEATER
Croton Falls ''Crimes of the Heart,'' comedy by Beth Henley. Friday through May 6. $25 to $29. Schoolhouse Theater, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-8477.

Pound Ridge ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' play about Emily Dickinson; presented by M and M productions. Friday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Hiram Halle Memorial Library, Intersection of Routes 124 and 137. (914) 764-5085.
White Plains ''Feathers Sometimes Soar on the Breath of God,'' presented by M and M productions. April 15 at 2:30 p.m. Free. White Plains Public Library, 100 Martine Avenue. (914) 422-1480.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

Annandale-on-Hudson ''In Someone Else's Skin,'' ''Facts on the Ground'' and ''Stutter and Twitch,'' mixed-media group exhibitions. April 15 through 29. Reception: April 15, 1 to 4 p.m. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Bard College, Center for Curatorial Studies. (845) 758-7598.

Armonk ''The Power of Color: The Power of the Brush,'' paintings by Joyce Wenglowski. Through April 15. Lecture by Gillian Greenhill Hannum, professor of art history at Manhattanville College: April 15 at 4 p.m.; $5; reservations required. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.
Bronx ''Sly,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 21. Donation: $5. Bronx River Art Center, 1087 Tremont Avenue. (718) 589-5819.
Bronx ''Sugar Buzz,'' mixed-media group show. Through May 15. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Lehman College Art Gallery, Bedford Park Boulevard West. (718) 960-8731.

Bronx ''Emily Dickinson Rendered,'' mixed-media group show of art inspired by the poetry of Emily Dickinson. Through May 25. Reception: April 15, 1 to 4:30 p.m. $2 to $4; members and under 6, free. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.

Croton Falls ''People Who Love People,'' group show. Through May 6. Reception: April 15, 1 to 3 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. The Schoolhouse Gallery, 3 Owens Road. (914) 277-3461.

Dobbs Ferry ''From Spain to Avalon,'' mixed-media exhibition. Wednesday through May 22. Reception: April 18, 2 to 4 p.m. Free. Hours: Sundays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. St. Cabrini Nursing Home, 115 Broadway. (914) 693-6800, Extension 522.

North Salem ''Brush With Nature,'' group exhibition featuring traditional and modern brush-painting techniques. April 14 through June 5. Hammond Museum and Japanese Stroll Garden, 28 Deveau Road. (914) 669-5033.

Pelham ''Lovely, Dark and Deep: Women Artists Retake the Fairy Tale,'' mixed-media group show. Through April 28. Free. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Pelham Art Center, 155 Fifth Avenue. (914) 738-2525.

Purchase ''On the Cusp,'' an instillation by Laurel Garcia Colvin. Monday through May 12. Reception: Wednesday, 5 to 7 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9:30 a.m. to 5 p.m. Brownson Gallery, 2900 Purchase Street. (914) 323-5331.

West Nyack ''A Sequence of Steps,'' photographs by Elizabeth Knowles, and ''Jiffy Pop,'' mixed-media group show. Both through April 29. Artist panel and cocktail party: April 14 at 8 p.m. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. Rockland Center for the Arts, 27 South Greenbush Road. (845) 358-0877.

Annandale-on-Hudson Mei-Mei Berssenbrugge and Sawako Nakayasu, poetry performance and reading. Thursday at 5 p.m. Free. Weis Cinema, (845) 758-1539.

Garrison Pots, Painters and Petticoats,'' seminar series: ''Hudson Valley Stoneware and Redware,'' lecture by George Lukacs, historian and author. April 14 at 10 a.m. Free. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Boscobel Restoration, 1601 Route 9D. (845) 265-9575.

Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. The Studio: An Alternative Space for Contemporary Art, 2 Maryland Avenue. (914) 273-1452.

Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 10 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. Wave Hill, 675 West 252nd Street. (718) 549-3200.
